import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from matplotlib import rcParams
import scipy as sp
source.b776bfc3:
df_train = pd.read_csv("../input/titanic/train.csv", skipinitialspace = True)
df_test = pd.read_csv("../input/titanic/test.csv", skipinitialspace = True)
source.91fcca4f:
rcParams["figure.figsize"] = 6,4

plt.bar( df_train.Sex.unique(),df_train.Sex.value_counts(), color = ["cyan", "purple"], width = 0.35, ec = "black")
plt.xlabel("Sex", size = 16)
plt.ylabel("Count", size = 16)
plt.title("   Count of Passengers by Gender   ", size = 22)
source.d7031615:
rcParams["figure.figsize"] = 6,6

ax = plt.gca()
ax.set_facecolor("xkcd:black")

plt.bar(df_train.Pclass.unique(),df_train.Pclass.value_counts(), color = ["cyan", "magenta","yellow"], width = 0.35, ec = "black")
plt.xticks([1,2,3])
plt.xlabel("Class", size = 16)
plt.ylabel("Count", size = 16)
plt.title("   Count of Passengers by Class   ", size = 22)
